alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Dade; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 11:21AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Catoosa, Whitfield, Walker and Dade Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1121 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Middle Valley, or 9 miles northeast of Chattanooga, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Dalton, Lafayette, Ringgold, Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Rossville, Chickamauga, Varnell, Lookout Mountain, Tunnel Hill, Cohutta, Chattanooga Valley, La Fayette, Center Post, Blue Spring, Fairview, Linwood, Beaverdale, Villanow and Chattanooga Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
